item.title: Protesters are back at Davos: Swiss police break-up hundreds of protestors, including Austrian heiress and millionaire Marlene Engelhorn
item.description: Some 300 people including two millionaires protested in Davos on Sunday. Demonstrators carried placards with slogans such as "Tax the rich", "Shut up!...

item.title: With Trump 2.0, the balance of power shifts from banks to Silicon Valley
item.description: What the new administration could mean for financial technology—and beyond.

item.title: Spanish PM proposes to outright ban home purchases by people outside the EU—as part of efforts to tackle the housing crisis
item.description: Following the success of the socialist party's proposal last week to slap a tax of up to 100 percent on non-EU property purchases.

item.title: Bird flu found in commercial poultry flock in top U.S. chicken production state for 1st time amid nationwide outbreak
item.description: For the first time since the 2022 countrywide outbreak, bird flu hit a poultry producer in Georgia, the nation's top state for chicken production.

item.title: Aon’s new CFO on 4 corporate ‘megatrends’—and his advice for finance chiefs
item.description: Not only are the risks companies face more complex, but they're interconnected, says Edmund Reese.
